intro: Galium auratum, commonly known as silverweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium auratum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
